ABOUT_US_LABELS.TITLE: Get to know more about
ABOUT_US_LABELS.DESCRIPTION: Literata es un proyecto enfocado en ayudarte a practicar tus habilidades de escritura en español mexicano, a través de actividades que incluyen retroalimentación inmediata, reforzamiento de vocabulario e información relevante de la lengua española.
ABOUT_US_LABELS.HISTORY: Literata is a project developed by students of Computer Systems Engineering at the Escuela Superior de Cómputo from Instituto Politécnico Nacional. The main goal is to help spanish learners to improve their writing skills at early stages.

BLOG_LABELS.HOME_LABEL: Find out more about the spanish language

CARDS_GAME.INSTRUCTIONS_DESCRIPTION:
In this activity you are going to see a box with an image and three option buttons. 
 Your task is to click on the button which shows the {{ description_word }} depicted in the image. After clicking one option another box with a new image will appear. At the end of the activity you will be able to see your score.
CARDS_GAME.FINAL_SCORE: Your answered correctly {{correct_answers}} questions out of {{number_of_questions}}
CARDS_GAME.PROFESSIONS_OCCUPATIONS_CARD_DESCRIPTION: This activity gives you a space to practice vocabulary related to professions and occupations
CARDS_GAME.DEMONYMS_CARD_DESCRIPTION: This activity gives you a space to practice vocabulary related to demonyms

SPELLING_ACTIVITIES.USAGE_OF_THE_LETTER_U_CARD_DESCRIPTION: This activity gives you a space to practice the usage of the letter 'u'
SPELLING_ACTIVITIES.INSTRUCTIONS: In the following boxes you will see 3 forms of writing a word. Your task is to write in the input field the only one that is correctly written. Once you are ready click on the 'Send' button to check your answer.
SPELLING_ACTIVITIES.ORTHOGRAPHIC_RULE_OF_U_DESCRIPTION_1: The letter u is written with diaeresis ( ü ) if all the following conditions are met:
SPELLING_ACTIVITIES.ORTHOGRAPHIC_RULE_OF_U_DESCRIPTION_2:
1. It is found after the letter g .
2. It is positioned before the letter ' i ' or ' e '.
3. If the distinct sound of the letter u is heard when pronouncing a word.

GRAMMAR_CONJUGATION_ACTIVITY.TITLE: Conjugate verbs
GRAMMAR_CONJUGATION_ACTIVITY.DESCRIPTION: In this activity you will be able to practice the conjugation of regular verbs in the Spanish present indicative tense.
GRAMMAR_CONJUGATION_ACTIVITY.INSTRUCTIONS: In the boxes below, you will see a verb in its infinitive form and different subjects. The activity consists of writing the correct conjugation of the verb according to the rules of the Spanish present indicative tense next to each corresponding person.
GRAMMAR_CONJUGATION_ACTIVITY.GRAMMAR_GUIDE_TITLE: How do I conjugate regular verbs in the Spanish present indicative tense?
GRAMMAR_CONJUGATION_ACTIVITY.GRAMMAR_GUIDE_EXPLANATION:
The conjugation of regular verbs in the Spanish present indicative tense is formed by adding a specific ending to the verb root. There are three conjugation models: those ending in -ar, those ending in -er and those ending in -ir.

  1. Verbs ending in -ar

    They are those that are conjugated like the verb "amar".
    SubjectConjugated verb
    Yoamo
    Túamas
    El/Ellaama
    Nosotrosamamos
    Ustedes aman
    Ellos/Ellas aman

  2. Verbs ending in -er

    They are those that are conjugated like the verb "comer".
    SubjectConjugated verb
    Yocomo
    Túcomes
    El/Ellacome
    Nosotroscomemos
    Ustedes comen
    Ellos/Ellas comen

  3. Verbs ending in -ir

    They are those that are conjugated like the verb "vivir".
    SubjectConjugated verb
    Yovivo
    Túvives
    El/Ellavive
    Nosotrosvivimos
    Ustedes viven
    Ellos/Ellas viven

LAROUSSE_REFERENCE: I. Munguía Zataraín, M. E. Munguía Zatarain, y G. Rocha Romero, Gramática lengua española. México, D.F.: Larousse, 2013.
RAE_BASICS_OF_GRAMMAR_AND_ORTHOGRAPHY: Real Academia Española y Asociación de Academias de la Lengua Española, Eds., Gramática y ortografía básicas de la lengua española, 1.a ed. Madrid: Editorial Planeta, 2019.
